intro: Heliotropium luzonicum subsp. angustissimum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its small, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, ovate leaves with a pointed tip. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Boraginaceae family.
